ひらがな	"<span class=""alt-forms"">平仮名</span><br><br><span class=""readings"">ヒラガナ</span><br><br><span class=""definitions"">hiragana</span>"	Words-In-Hiragana
カタカナ	"<span class=""alt-forms"">片仮名</span><br><br>かたかな<br><br>katakana, a set of Japanese syllabary characters, secondary to hiragana, derived from portions of Chinese characters whose sounds approximate the Japanese sound being represented. katakana is mostly used for transliteration from western languages.<br><br>if you still don't know this, you're a fucking dumbass." <ruby>以上<rt>いじょう</rt></ruby>	"<span class=""readings"">いじょう</span><br><br><span class=""definitions"">the aforementioned, the foregoing<br>equal to or more; includes the base number<br>(plain form verb) + 以上は: since, now that, so long as, once<br><br>That is all. (used at the end of a text to indicate that there is nothing further)</span><br><br><span class=""sample-sentences""><ruby>彼<rt>かれ</rt></ruby>は<ruby>成績<rt>せいせき</rt></ruby>は<ruby>平均<rt>へいきん</rt></ruby><ruby><b>以上</b><rt>いじょう</rt></ruby>です。<br>もうこれ<ruby><b>以上</b><rt>いじょう</rt></ruby><ruby>食<rt>た</rt></ruby>べられない。<br>この<ruby>中<rt>なか</rt></ruby>の<ruby>誰<rt>だれ</rt></ruby>が<ruby>犯人<rt>はんにん</rt></ruby>かわからない<ruby><b>以上</b><rt>いじょう</rt></ruby>、この<ruby>家<rt>いえ</rt></ruby>にいるのは<ruby>危険<rt>きけん</rt></ruby>だ。<br><ruby>妻<rt>つま</rt></ruby>が<ruby>私<rt>わたし</rt></ruby>を<ruby>愛<rt>あい</rt></ruby>してくれている<ruby><b>以上</b><rt>いじょう</rt></ruby>、<ruby>私<rt>わたし</rt></ruby>も<ruby>彼女<rt>かのじょ</rt></ruby>を<ruby>幸<rt>しあわ</rt></ruby>せにするつもりだ。<br><ruby>私<rt>わたし</rt></ruby>はプロである<ruby><b>以上</b><rt>いじょう</rt></ruby>、しっかりと<ruby>商品<rt>しょうひん</rt></ruby>をお<ruby>客様<rt>きゃくさま</rt></ruby>に<ruby>届<rt>とど</rt></ruby>ける。<br><ruby>負<rt>ま</rt></ruby>けた<ruby><b>以上</b><rt>いじょう</rt></ruby>は、<ruby>約束<rt>やくそく</rt></ruby>した<ruby>物<rt>もの</rt></ruby>をあげるしかないな。<br>この<ruby>世界<rt>せかい</rt></ruby>に<ruby>生<rt>う</rt></ruby>まれた<ruby><b>以上</b><rt>いじょう</rt></ruby>、<ruby>幸<rt>しあわ</rt></ruby>せに<ruby>生<rt>い</rt></ruby>きていきたい。<br><ruby><b>以上</b><rt>いじょう</rt></ruby>です。</span>"	Kanji

おる	"<span class=""alt-forms"">居る</span><br><br><span class=""definitions"">(intransitive)<br>(<em>of inanimate objects</em>) to exist, to be, to have<br>(<em>after a verb in て-form</em>) to be (doing): indicates a progressive or continuous sense; the verb ending -ておる is often contracted to -とる<br>(<em>Chugoku, Shikoku, Kyūshū, after a verb in the conjunctive form</em>) to be (doing); a continuous sense; often transformed to よる<br><br>A variant of いる used mainly in Western Japan.<br>In standard Japanese, it is usually used in humble language (<ruby>謙譲語<rt>けんじょうご</rt></ruby>) or polite language (<ruby>丁寧語<rt>ていねいご</rt></ruby>) as おります or in certain archaic/literary expressions.</span><br><br><span class=""sample-sentences"">お<ruby>待<rt>ま</rt></ruby>ちして<b>おりました</b>。<br>ご<ruby>親切<rt>しんせつ</rt></ruby>に<ruby>感謝<rt>かんしゃ</rt></ruby>して<b>おります</b>。<br>またのお<ruby>越<rt>こ</rt></ruby>しを<ruby>心<rt>こころ</rt></ruby>からお<ruby>待<rt>ま</rt></ruby>ち<ruby>申<rt>もう</rt></ruby>し<ruby>上<rt>あ</rt></ruby>げて<b>おります</b>。</span>"	Japanese-Verbs Words-In-Hiragana
おっしゃる	"<span class=""alt-forms"">仰る、仰有る、<br>仰っしゃる</span><br><br><span class=""definitions"">(transitive)<br>(<em>honorific</em>) to say (honorific for <ruby>言<rt>い</rt></ruby>う)</span><br><br><span class=""sample-sentences""><ruby>私<rt>わたし</rt></ruby>にできることがありましたら<b>おっしゃって</b>ください。<br><b>おっしゃる</b>ことは<ruby>理解<rt>りかい</rt></ruby>できています。<br><ruby>何<rt>なん</rt></ruby>と<b>おっしゃいました</b>か。<br>ご<ruby>都合<rt>つごう</rt></ruby>のいい<ruby>場所<rt>ばしょ</rt></ruby>を<b>おっしゃって</b>くださいませんか。</span>"	Japanese-Verbs Words-In-Hiragana

<ruby>旦那<rt>だんな</rt></ruby>	"<span class=""alt-forms"">檀那</span><br><br><span class=""readings"">だんな</span><br><br><span class=""definitions"">(<em>Buddhism</em>) generosity as one of the Buddhist perfections (पारमिता (pāramitā))<br>(<em>Buddhism</em>) a donation of money, goods, or service to monks or a temple<br>(<em>Buddhism</em>) a person who makes such a donation: a patron<br>(<em>archaic</em>) in the Japanese medieval period, overnight visitors to a shrine or temple<br>1. (<em>archaic</em>) by extension, a gentleman<br>broadly, a patron, a husband, a master:<br>1. (<em>honorific</em>) a master of servants, a boss of employees, the master of the house<br>2. (<em>honorific</em>) by extension, an honorific for one's own or someone else's husband<br>3. (<em>honorific</em>) also by extension, used by shopkeepers to address a male customer or by an artisan to refer to one's own school or lineage<br>4. (<em>honorific</em>) a term used by a concubine, mistress, or geisha to refer to one's own patron: a sugar daddy<br>5.
